instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.820-2850A: What is 820-2850A? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  shorted out on the <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>
threads.message:
Hi just got a computer in from a customer. he said he was changing the battery and left his screwdriver on the board it touched pin 17 on the <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> and he said it was cherry hot by the time he found it.  the chip was fried and the tab pulled up i reconnected the tab and replaced the <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> but every time i plug in the charger it starts to fry the power io and the charger.  any ideas? 

Many thanks
Nate

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  shorted out on the <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>
[SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  shorted out on the <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>
threads.message:
okay yeah the F7040 i changed out and its no longer burning up the power io.  i get a green light now. but no fan or power.  is it possible the <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> i changed out got fried again from the f7040?  

Thanks for the help [USER="36"]aprendiz[/USER]

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  shorted out on the <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>

[SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  shorted out on the <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>
threads.message: OK, Voltage on pin 2 from <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>, resistance between pin 27/28 and 17/18.......

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  shorted out on the <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>
[SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  shorted out on the <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>
threads.message: Resistance between pin 27 and 28 should be 20ohm and between pin 17 and 18 should be about 3ohm, check again.... Also check voltage on pin 3 from <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>...

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  shorted out on the <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>
threads.message:
shit yeah your right i messed up there.  getting 20ohms pin 27/28

2.8-2.9ohms 17/18

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  shorted out on the <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>
[SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  shorted out on the <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>
threads.message: ok, for me is a bad <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> or not properly soldered

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  shorted out on the <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>
threads.message: okay very possible its bad. donor boards ya know. i will pull it off  make sure it was on good and try another one.

threads.message: checked the <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> and swapped it out. still the same green light no power.

[SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  shorted out on the <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>
threads.message: what should it be if there is no res to ground?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  shorted out on the <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>
threads.message: If there is not low resistance there is somethig wrong on ISL, maybe bad or not soldered properly....

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  shorted out on the <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>
[SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  shorted out on the <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>
threads.message:
Yeah no i def did not have it soldered good. checked it out real quick and one of the tabs was not connected. cleaned it up and re seated it and alls good. Thanks for the help Aprendiz and thanks for dropping in duke, that answered a questions i had about using a dif ISL.  

Thanks again!
